page.title: 17SCHOOL CENTENARY
page.content: During the year from January to December 1985 the Leigh Sinton Church of England Primary school celebrated its Centenary.The first school log book was opened on the 1st January 1885.The year was marked by many events including a Victorian Summer Fair,a traditional walk across the footpaths to church for the Ascension Day service and a service of Thanksgiving for the work of the school during the last 100 years.This service enabled the parents to see the entertainment presented by the children to old scholars,Governors and the Bishop of Worcester on Centenary Day.The Bishop unveiled a plaque and later in the year distributed medals to the children to commemorate the Centenary.One of the more pleasing facets of the Year was the renewed contact with ex-scholars.
